message.content:
We only need to sum the cash‐flow related transactions that represent an acquisition of fixed assets (that is, capital expenditures). In the sample problem an extra row (with a type like “Fixed Assets Purchase”) was recorded with an amount of 305354.43. In the new table the very first three rows are the “Initial20231231001” entries. One of those (the one with type “Fixed Assets”) shows 5000000.0 but that record is the opening balance (the “initial” fixed assets) and is not considered a “new purchase” during the period. All the following rows are “Purchase”, “Sale”, “Expense”, etc. (for items such as inventory, supplies, etc.) and none of them describes an acquisition of fixed assets.

Thus no additional fixed asset purchase transaction occurred during this period. In other words, apart from the opening balance no new fixed asset purchase is recorded.

Therefore the “final purchase of fixed assets” that would show in the cash flow statement equals 0.

We now present the answer in the required JSON format.

------------------------------------------------

{"solution": {'Purchase of Fixed Assets': '0'}}
